intro: Byrsonima verbascifolia f. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-leaved false flax, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
